ratings.question_text: I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: What is the name of your TA?
comments: Nothing toshow..

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-10, if you wish
comments: As much as acquiring academic knowledge in crucial, what separates high professional achievers from non or average achievers is their leadership ability and skills. The congenial teaching environment and discussion sessions that are woven into the classes makes it very ideal for opening up and sharing values, ethics and long-held belief-systems. This is the kind of course that trains one for life because it transcends academics. The relevance of this course cannot be overemphasized.
Awesome Class !!!
Thank you so much Chad!
The congenial class environment that encourages sharing of ideas, knowledge, beliefs, ethics, etc.

The fact that we got to practice the theory we discussed in class by forming an organizational hierarchy within the class and planning all the details of our Washington trip ourselves, and meeting with leaders from different environmental fields. I learned a lot more about group dynamics, organization and management than I would have if this was just another seminar.
The field trip to Washington, DC where we met with leaders and had the chance to learn from them the secrets of leadership.

The best thing about this course was definitely having the opportunity to go to Washington DC and use everything that we had learned in theory into practice. Meeting all of those incredible leaders was what truly made this seminar incredible.
Chad !!!
The field trip is marvelous. I learned so much from it!

the DC trip was very rewarding. The instructor is very well connected to the various leaders in DC, as well as many of our fellow classmates in class, thus we were able to meet many NGO, governmental leaders in DC. I greatly benefited from meetings with these leaders through asking them questions and discussions in round table meetings. Monday night Monacle dinner was once in a life time experience- watching environmental leaders gave speech on state of the art issues was breath taking. thank you chad!
Learned lots of thing more than I expected
Chad was very open to listening to the students and hearing what they had to say. It was a mutual learning environment

narratives.question_text: The things about this course most in need of improvement are:
comments: The trip to Washington is too short and over-loaded, it could be either lengthened or two trips embarked upon at different times.
It doesn't need improvement.
I don't think that something needs improvement.
I think there should be more transparency in the way things are graded. To this day, I have no idea if I'm going to get an A+ in this class or a D...
The lecture was a little bit disorganized and random.It is better for us to discuss our reflection paper.
if there is anything that should be improved- the efficiency of our meetings before DC trip can be improved. However, we were able to gain much democracy among the meetings.
Can make the weekly class more intense

narratives.question_text: What was the availability and quality of help you received of the instructor and TA?
comments: Instructor was available via email and phone outside class periods and by meeting appointments
Our instructor was very approachable and available.
I received the maximum quality of help from the instructor when needed.
Chad Oliver was tremendously helpful in and out of class. I could not have reasonably asked for any more!
sufficient
Pretty much!
cannot be better.

narratives.question_text: Discuss if you wish how this course fits into your overall program.
comments: Well, since I aspire to be a leader in my chosen profession, I guess it fits perfectly. This course provides essential tools for succeeding as a leader.

I am only an undergraduate, but eventually I want to go in to international business. Such a career will require that I be able to lead a team, as well as keep environmental sustainability at the fore of my efforts.
It helps me a lot for my future career life!
It is always great to have a leadership refresher course.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: Because I wanted some theoretical and practical training in leadership skills.
I've never taken a class like this before and it seemed very interesting. And it was.
As a future leader, I need as much training as possible.
I am interested in leadership skills and would love to attend the field trip in DC.
Want to learn more about leadership, and meet leaders of the environmental fields
to learn about different styles of leadership

narratives.question_text: Did it live up to your expectations?
comments: Very much so
Yes, it surpassed them.
yes
Expectations far exceeded.
Yes
yes.
Yes
yes

narratives.question_text: Did you get out of it what you expected?
comments: Yes
Yes, and more.
More than I expected.
Yes. The field trip was so excellent. I learnt much more than I thought.
yes.
yes

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: It provided an opportunity to learn from other students from different parts of the world with different temperaments, attitudes and values. It was a great opportunity for knowledge sharing and learning how to work effectively in teams. The downside is that sometimes it takes a long time to reach a consensus and some individual attitudes can sometimes disrupt team cohesion and effectiveness. It was great figuring out how to accommodate diversity and harnessing the individual strengths and opportunities available to create a winning team.
The group work gave us practical insight into how organizational hierarchieswork and we learned more about working together and each other than we would have otherwise. It was a great experience.

Advantages: you learn to communicate effectively and collaborate with people from all over the world, to respect their unique mental models, to stick to your role and not enter other people's jurisdiction.Disadvantages: every disadvantage you see at firt turns into an advantage at the end.
N/A
It was challenging and rewarding.
We learnt leadership skills in group work. It was amazing.
advantages- you have to work with a group.disadvantages- you have to work with a group.

narratives.question_text: For students taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: Take the readings and lectures very seriously and take the opportunity to learn from your classmates, because they possess a wealth of information and knowledge.

Definitely take this class, the instructor is amazing, the experience of planning and going on the Washington trip is great, and you get to meet many interesting people, and it's a great networking opportunity as well.

Make sure you find out exactly what is expected of you to do well in this course. I made the mistake of merely showing up every day and turning in assignments when I had to, but I never bothered to ask how I was actually doing in the class.
Writing the reflection in time!
The reading materials are extremely helpful. Please read them.
